description:
Member of Congress seeks an energetic and self-motivated individual to serve
as a District Representative in an active Congressional district office. Duties
include representing the Member of Congress in the community, maintaining
positive relationships with constituents, other local elected officials, and
business and community leaders and organizations.

Additionally, this individual is also responsible for handling constituent
casework in their assigned issue areas, which includes answering casework
correspondence, meeting with constituents, communicating with constituents,
and serving as a liaison with federal and local agencies.

Candidates must be able to work quickly in a high pressure environment,
meet very tight deadlines, and have exceptional writing and organizational
skills. Fluent in Spanish and Ventura County ties are a plus but not required.
Must be available, as necessary, to work evenings and/or weekend hours.
responsibilities: Representing the Member of Congress in the community
Maintaining positive relationships with constituents, other local elected officials, and business and community leaders and organizations
Handling constituent casework in their assigned issue areas
Answering casework correspondence
Meeting with constituents
Communicating with constituents
Serving as a liaison with federal and local agencies
qualifications: Ability to work quickly in a high pressure environment
Ability to meet very tight deadlines
Exceptional writing and organizational skills
Fluent in Spanish and Ventura County ties are a plus but not required
Must be available, as necessary, to work evenings and/or weekend hours
how_to_apply:
Candidates should submit a cover letter, resume, and appropriate writing
samples to CA26Resumes@gmail.com with just “District Representative” in
the subject line. No phone calls, faxes, or walk-ins, please.
equal_opportunity:
This office is an equal opportunity employer and encourages candidates from
diverse backgrounds to apply.

description: Responsibilities include planning and implementing communications strategy across a broad portfolio, working closely with legislative and district staff to effectively communicate the Member’s message, handling daily media inquiries, maintaining relationships with national, Chicago, and local reporters, writing talking points and press releases, pitching op-eds, overseeing paid constituent outreach (franking) budget, managing website, producing videos and social media content, and planning and promoting press events in DC and the district.
responsibilities: Planning and implementing communications strategy across a broad portfolio
Working closely with legislative and district staff to effectively communicate the Member’s message
Handling daily media inquiries
Maintaining relationships with national, Chicago, and local reporters
Writing talking points and press releases
Pitching op-eds
Overseeing paid constituent outreach (franking) budget
Managing website
Producing videos and social media content
Planning and promoting press events in DC and the district
qualifications: Previous communications and/or Capitol Hill experience
Strong writing and oral communication skills
The ability to multitask and prioritize under pressure
Team players with a good sense of humor
Spanish fluency is a plus.
how_to_apply: Please send cover letter, resume, and a writing sample as one attachment to ILCongressional.Jobs@mail.house.gov
equal_opportunity: Women, veterans and diverse candidates are encouraged to apply.

description:
Senior Southern Democratic Member seeks a Chief of Staff to lead the
Member’s offices. The Chief of Staff is responsible for providing leadership
to and managing a team dedicated to advancing the Member’s legislative
agenda, fulfilling a communications strategy, and administering all office
operations.

The role of Chief of Staff requires significant Hill, political, and management
experience with a strong understanding of legislative procedure and policy.
The position requires knowledge of critical issues under the jurisdiction of the
House Judiciary and Transportation and Infrastructure Committees and a
desire to develop comprehensive solutions to improve the quality of life for
consumers and middle- and low- income communities. Focus upon
technology, telecommunications, and intellectual property issues is preferred.

Responsibilities include staffing the Member on issue-related events,
representing the Member on his/her behalf, and other committee-related
duties.

The candidate must be an excellent oral and written communicator, a strong
leader, detail-oriented, politically savvy, have demonstrated strong policy
experience, ability to handle multiple, complex, and competing tasks, have
excellent organizational and proofreading skills. Ties to Atlanta, Hill
experience, and experience using Intranet Quorum (IQ) are preferred.
Attorney candidates are strongly preferred.
responsibilities: Staffing the Member on issue-related events
Representing the Member on his/her behalf
Other committee-related duties
qualifications: Significant Hill, political, and management experience
Strong understanding of legislative procedure and policy
Desire to make and grow relationships with other staff, members, lobbyists, and associations
Knowledge of key issues related to House Judiciary and Transportation and Infrastructure Committees
Strong leadership, interpersonal communication and collaborative skills
Ability to think creatively, not take themselves too seriously, collaborate with Member on the development and implementation of legislative, press, and political strategy
Proven track record of success, multi-tasking, managing a productive team and running an effective operation
Ability to use and leverage technology to maximize operational effectiveness and support tech-savvy member
Willingness to work evenings and weekends
Knowledge of Atlanta and other urban cities
Must be a team player with an excellent temperament, deportment, and a sense of humor!

description:
The office of U.S. Congresswoman Katie Porter seeks a digital/communications professional to be based in her Orange County office. The ideal candidate is highly motivated and detail-oriented, with experience in digital media strategy, graphic design, and video editing.

The Digital Director/Press Secretary will be responsible for drafting statements, releases, social media copy, and advisories; staffing the Congresswoman, including taking pictures at community events and shooting direct-to-camera videos; designing graphics and editing videos; compiling daily press clips; and maintaining reporter lists. Candidates with Orange County ties are preferred.
responsibilities: Drafting statements, releases, social media copy, and advisories
Staffing the Congresswoman, including taking pictures at community events and shooting direct-to-camera videos
Designing graphics and editing videos
Compiling daily press clips
Maintaining reporter lists
qualifications: Experience in digital media strategy
Graphic design experience
Video editing experience
Highly motivated
Detail-oriented
Orange County ties preferred
how_to_apply:
Applicants should submit a resume, cover letter, a writing sample, and two examples of digital media projects to KatiePorter.Press@mail.house.gov and include “Digital Director/Press Secretary” in the subject line.
Candidates will be considered on a rolling basis, with a preference for a start date in May. This is not an entry-level position.
equal_opportunity: Congresswoman Katie Porter is committed to hiring and maintaining a diverse staff; candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

description:
Job responsibilities include: managing the front office, greeting visitors, answering phone calls, managing tour requests, processing flag requests, overseeing the internship program, aiding with constituent correspondence, and assisting the Member and staff as needed.

Candidates possess strong organizational and communication skills as well as the ability to successfully handle multiple tasks and deadlines under pressure.

Internship and/or other Hill experience is preferred. New York ties are also a plus.
responsibilities: managing the front office
greeting visitors
answering phone calls
managing tour requests
processing flag requests
overseeing the internship program
aiding with constituent correspondence
assisting the Member and staff as needed
qualifications: strong organizational and communication skills
ability to successfully handle multiple tasks and deadlines under pressure
Internship and/or other Hill experience is preferred
New York ties are also a plus
how_to_apply: Please email your resume, cover letter, and 3 references to houseresumes21@gmail.com with the subject “Staff Assistant Application.”

description: Active, hard-working Member of House Leadership seeks an outstanding Communications Director for a fast-paced office.
responsibilities: Planning and implementing communications strategy across a broad portfolio
Working closely with legislative and district staff to effectively communicate the Member’s message
Handling daily media inquiries
Maintaining relationships with national and local reporters
Writing talking points and press releases
Pitching op-eds
Managing website
Producing videos and social media content
Planning and pitching press events in DC and the district
Overseeing daily clips
Keeping press lists up-to-date
qualifications: Hill press experience
Strong writing and oral communication skills
The ability to multitask and prioritize under pressure
A good sense of humor
Connecticut ties are a plus
how_to_apply: Please send cover letter, resume, and a writing sample as one attachment to ctcommsjob@gmail.com

office: The Office of Congressman Andy Kim (NJ03)
description:
The Office of Congressman Andy Kim (NJ03) seeks a Digital/Press
Assistant to assist the Communications Director in formulating and executing
digital and traditional communications efforts for the office.

The ideal candidate is a team-player with strong written and verbal
communication skills, attention to detail, follow through, self-motivation,
ability to multi-task and an even temperament.

The position is located in our Washington, D.C. office and will primarily
report to the Communications Director.
responsibilities: Creating digital content such as graphics, videos and ads
Drafting social media posts and statements
Working with House Franking to get materials approved
qualifications: 1-3 years of digital or press experience
Proficient in digital graphic design and editing programs
Proficient in creating ads in social media platforms
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Attention to detail
Follow through
Self-motivation
Ability to multi-task
Even temperament
how_to_apply:
Please send resume and cover letter to nj03resumes@mail.house.gov with “Digital/Press Assistant” in the subject line.
No phone calls, faxes, or walk-ins please.
equal_opportunity:
The Office of Congressman Andy Kim is an equal opportunity employer, and
as such, is committed to building and maintaining an inclusive and diverse
work environment.

description:
Job responsibilities include: acting as the representative for the Member; answering casework correspondence; meeting with constituents; serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies; screening and referring cases, when appropriate, to other district offices; preparing reports for the District Director on pending cases; assessing casework for problems requiring legislative action; and making recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff.

This position will have a significant focus on casework and facilitating communications between constituents and federal agencies.
A successful candidate for this position will be empathetic, has the ability to actively listen, problem-solve, and be comfortable documenting casework progression in a database.
responsibilities: Acting as the representative for the Member
Answering casework correspondence
Meeting with constituents
Serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies
Screening and referring cases, when appropriate, to other district offices
Preparing reports for the District Director on pending cases
Assessing casework for problems requiring legislative action
Making recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff
qualifications: Highly organized
Detail-oriented
Friendly
Strong written and verbal communication skills in both English and a second language
Fluent in Spanish, Farsi, Mandarin, or Korean (preference)
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Empathetic
Ability to actively listen
Problem-solve
Comfortable documenting casework progression in a database
Minimum of 3- 5 years of case work experience for a Member of Congress
Degree in social work (preference)
Southern California ties are a plus
how_to_apply: Qualified candidates should submit a cover letter, resume, and writing sample to dd45lb@gmail.com with “Director of Constituent Services” in the subject line.
equal_opportunity: This office is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.

description:
Southern Republican seeks an experienced and enthusiastic Legislative Assistant to cover their work on Homeland Security Committee issues, among others.

This is not an entry level position.

Excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills are essential along with the ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment.
responsibilities: Drafting legislation
Writing hearing statements and legislative memos
Preparing briefing materials
qualifications: 3-5 years of experience, ideally 2-3 on the Hill
Solid grasp of House procedures
Deep understanding of relevant policy
how_to_apply: Qualified candidates should include in their application a resume and professional references. Please send applications to congressionaljobs2805@gmail.com with “Legislative Assistant” in the subject line.

description:
Qualified candidates should have a minimum of 2 years’ experience managing a team, possess excellent oral and written communications skills, highly organized, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects.

A flexible schedule and ability to travel throughout the district is required.
qualifications: Minimum of 2 years’ experience managing a team
Excellent oral and written communications skills
Highly organized
Ability to meet deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects
Flexible schedule
Ability to travel throughout the district
how_to_apply: Interested applicants should submit a cover letter, resume, and writing sample to cademhouseoffice@gmail.com please include Senior Staff in the subject line.
